messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A WITH KEGANG WU
messages.content: Engagement in business, teaching and science. Improvements in economy and public sector. Ambitious about growth rate, reduce national debt, generate jobs, assisting students, improving prosperity of the city. Holds a pragmatic stance towards environmental change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Focus on cutting business & personal taxation, grow the city. Attract investment and rebuild trust in the community and society.
Pragmatic approach to environmental changes. Fight against corruption.

issues.economy: Plans to grow the city, attracting investment, cut business and personal taxes.
issues.education: Assisted thousands of students getting into universities.
issues.environment: Pragmatic stance towards environmental change issues.
issues.governance: Fight corruption to rebuild trust in community and society.

leaflet.personalStatement: Spent twenty years as a scientist at the University of Liverpool. Assisted thousands of students getting into universities. Supported business and economy of the city.

politicalExperience.role: China Adviser for the British Chambers of Commerce
politicalExperience.achievements: Led a number of projects assisting Merseyside companies and helping to save hundreds of jobs.

contactInformation.address: Flat, Hanover Buildings, 11-13 Hanover Street, Liverpool, L1 3DN

endorsements.endorsement: A personal message from David Cameron endorsing Kegang Wu for his commitment to the NHS, economy, and tackling the deficit.

images.caption: Kegang will use his local knowledge to bring prosperity
Kegang knows how countries attract business
David Cameron in discussion with the Queen

leaflet.additionalNotes: The pamphlet contains a personal message from the party leader David Cameron, highlighting the need for change in Britain and a commitment to the NHS, economy and tackling the deficit.
